sub_topic: Calculation of coefficient of performance of a heat pump
message_1: A heat pump operates between the temperatures of 10°C and 18°C. If the heat pump consumes 500 J of work and extracts 2000 J of heat from the cold reservoir, determine the coefficient of performance of the heat pump.
message_2:
The coefficient of performance (COP) of a heat pump is the ratio of the heat delivered to the hot reservoir to the work input. In this case, the heat pump extracts 2000 J of heat from the cold reservoir and consumes 500 J of work. The total heat delivered to the hot reservoir is the sum of the heat extracted from the cold reservoir and the work input.

Heat delivered to the hot reservoir = Heat extracted from the cold reservoir + Work input
Q_hot = Q_cold + W
Q_hot = 2000 J + 500 J
Q_hot = 2500 J

Now, we can calculate the coefficient of performance (COP) using the formula:

COP = Q_hot / W
COP = 2500 J / 500 J
COP = 5

The coefficient of performance of the heat pump is 5.
